author: @eldeber
title: Detectan el primer caso de la nueva variante m√°s peligrosa de mpox fuera de √Åfrica | El Deber
text: Detectan el primer caso de la nueva variante m√°s peligrosa de mpox fuera de √Åfrica Autoridades sanitarias de Suecia informaron del primer paciente infectado con la nueva variante de mpox, cuyo brote ha generado una alerta mundial por parte de la OMS. La Agencia de Salud de Suecia inform√≥ este jueves que detect√≥ el que ser√≠a el primer caso de la nueva variante m√°s contagiosa de viruela s√≠mica (mpox) fuera de √Åfrica. La persona se contagi√≥ durante una estancia en una zona de √Åfrica donde actualmente hay un importante brote de mpox de la variante clade 1, seg√∫n la agencia. La noticia llega 24 horas despu√©s de que la Organizaci√≥n Mundial de la Salud (OMS) declarara que el brote de mpox en algunas zonas de √Åfrica era ya una emergencia de salud p√∫blica de importancia internacional. Al menos 450 personas han muerto desde que surgi√≥ un brote inicial en Rep√∫blica Democr√°tica del Congo hace unos meses. Desde entonces, la enfermedad se ha extendido a otras zonas de √Åfrica central y oriental. Seg√∫n Olivia Wigzell, directora en funciones de la Agencia de Salud P√∫blica de Suecia, la persona infectada hab√≠a buscado atenci√≥n en la zona de Estocolmo. Asegur√≥ que el hecho de que estuviera recibiendo tratamiento en el pa√≠s europeo no significaba que hubiera riesgo para la poblaci√≥n en general. La viruela s√≠mica, antes llamada viruela del mono, se transmite a trav√©s del contacto con una persona infectada, ya sea a trav√©s de relaciones sexuales o de la exposici√≥n de la piel o la respiraci√≥n cercana del paciente. Provoca s√≠ntomas parecidos a los de la gripe, lesiones cut√°neas y tiene un potencial mortal si no es tratada. Cuatro de cada 100 casos han resultado en muerte. Aunque la noticia del primer caso fuera de √Åfrica puede causar alarma, era de esperar y es probable que se produzcan m√°s casos en otras partes del mundo. Como han demostrado otros brotes de enfermedades, una r√°pida actuaci√≥n internacional puede ayudar a detener la propagaci√≥n de la enfermedad. Clade 1 y clade 2 Hasta ahora se conocen dos variantes de mpox, clade 1 y clade 2. Aunque el clade 2 caus√≥ una emergencia de salud p√∫blica en 2022, fue relativamente leve. De esa cepa se han identificado unos 300 casos en Suecia. El gobierno sueco se√±al√≥ que el clade 1 probablemente estaba relacionado con ‚Äúun mayor aumento de un curso m√°s grave de la enfermedad y una mayor mortalidad‚Äù. El clade 1 se propaga con mayor frecuencia a trav√©s de contactos estrechos en los hogares, donde suele infectar a los ni√±os. Por otro lado, la variante m√°s leve, clade 2, se propaga principalmente a trav√©s del contacto sexual. Seg√∫n el Centro Europeo para la Prevenci√≥n y el Control de las Enfermedades, los s√≠ntomas suelen aparecer entre 6 y 13 d√≠as despu√©s de la infecci√≥n, con fiebre y dolores de cabeza, erupciones o llagas y dolores musculares. ¬øC√≥mo se puede tratar? Una terapia dise√±ada para tratar la viruela tambi√©n puede ser √∫til para la mpox, pero las investigaciones sobre su eficacia son limitadas. Los brotes de mpox se pueden controlar mediante la prevenci√≥n y la mejor forma de hacerlo es con vacunas. Existen tres vacunas, pero por lo general solo est√°n disponibles para personas en riesgo o que han estado en contacto cercano con un infectado. De momento la OMS no recomienda vacunar a poblaciones enteras. Se necesitan m√°s ensayos de vacunas contra nuevas cepas de mpox para evaluar con exactitud cu√°nta protecci√≥n brindan. Recientemente la OMS solicit√≥ a las empresas farmac√©uticas presentar sus vacunas contra la mpox para uso de emergencia, incluso aunque esas vacunas no hayan sido aprobadas formalmente en los pa√≠ses donde se necesitan. [Haz clic aqu√≠](https://www.bbc.com/mundo?xtor=AL-73-%5Bpartner%5D-%5Beldeber.com.bo%5D-%5Blink%5D-%5Bmundo%5D-%5Bbizdev%5D-%5Bisapi%5D) para leer m√°s historias de BBC News Mundo. Tambi√©n puedes seguirnos en [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@BBCMundo), [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@bbcnewsmundo?is_from_webapp=1), [X](https://twitter.com/bbcmundo), Y recuerda que puedes recibir notificaciones en nuestra app. Descarga la √∫ltima versi√≥n y act√≠valas.

author: Enrique Dur√°n
title: Innomy, conquistar al sector de bebidas vegetales con su micoprote√≠na o morir en la orilla
text:
El enfoque en micoprote√≠nas solubles para bebidas vegetales se ha convertido en la principal apuesta de Innomy en su pivotaje hacia ingredientes de valor a√±adido. Durante los √∫ltimos meses, ha estado involucrada en dos proyectos con sendos operadores top 5 sectoriales, y si bien los test han demostrado ser un √©xito, su continuidad est√° en el aire. Innomy se declara en una situaci√≥n l√≠mite, motivada por el insistente d√©ficit de financiaci√≥n.
Innomy, conquistar al sector de bebidas vegetales con su micoprote√≠na o morir en la orilla

author: PTI
title: Take part in Centre's PMAY and solar power initiatives, Union minister tells developers | Science-Environment
text: Take part in Centre's PMAY and solar power initiatives, Union minister tells developers [PTI](/pti-stories)| Thane | Updated: 16-02-2024 16:31 IST | Created: 16-02-2024 16:31 IST - Country: - India Union Minister Kapil Patil on Friday asked real estate developers to contribute in fulfilling the vision of Prime Minister Narendra Modi of housing for all by participating in the PM Awas Yojana and encouraging rooftop solar power initiatives. He also said he would take up Goods and Services Tax issues faced by the real estate sector with the finance ministry. ''Developers must be part of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana to contribute towards PM Modi's vision of housing for all. They must align their objectives with broader national objectives and encourage adoption of rooftop solar power initiatives,'' Patil said. He was speaking at the 21st edition of the property exhibition of CREDIA-MCHI, which was also attended by local MLA Pratap Sarnaik and Thane Municipal Corporation additional commissioner Sandeep Malavi. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) ALSO READ [Sitharaman says 11.8 crore farmers provided financial assistance under PM KISAN Yojana.](/article/agency-wire/2795114-sitharaman-says-118-crore-farmers-provided-financial-assistance-under-pm-kisan-yojana) [Under PM Mudra Yojana, 43 crore loans aggregating to Rs 22.5 lakh crore were extended: Sitharaman.](/article/agency-wire/2795119-under-pm-mudra-yojana-43-crore-loans-aggregating-to-rs-225-lakh-crore-were-extended-sitharaman) [Sitharaman says 11.8 crore farmers receive financial assistance under PM KISAN Yojana](/article/headlines/2795155-sitharaman-says-118-crore-farmers-receive-financial-assistance-under-pm-kisan-yojana) [Sitharaman says 43 crore loans aggregating to Rs 22.5 lakh cr extended under PM Mudra Yojana](/article/law-order/2795138-sitharaman-says-43-crore-loans-aggregating-to-rs-225-lakh-cr-extended-under-pm-mudra-yojana) [30 crore Mudra yojana loans given to women in 10 years: FM Sitharaman.](/article/agency-wire/2795123-30-crore-mudra-yojana-loans-given-to-women-in-10-years-fm-sitharaman)

author: James Olley
title: Arteta: Arsenal need goals, not better tech to win
text: Mikel Arteta rued a lack of technology as [Arsenal](/football/team?id=359) were embroiled in another VAR controversy during Thursday's [2-0 home](/football/match/_/gameId/671218) defeat to [West Ham United](/football/team?id=371), but said his team had plenty of chances to score goals and win. [Tom√°s Soucek](/soccer/player/_/id/230666/tomas-soucek) opened the scoring on 13 minutes, but the goal survived a lengthy check as replays suggested the ball may have gone out as [Jarrod Bowen](/soccer/player/_/id/201089/jarrod-bowen) pulled it back from the byline to create the chance. - [Stream on ESPN+: LaLiga, Bundesliga, more (U.S.)](/espnplus/schedule/_/type/upcoming/categoryId/119cfa41-71d4-39bf-a790-6273a52b0259/channel/ESPN_PLUS) With the goal given by on-field referee Michael Oliver, there was insufficient evidence from the available camera angles to conclusively determine whether it had left the pitch, replicating a similar incident which saw [Anthony Gordon](/soccer/player/_/id/268782/anthony-gordon)'s strike in the Gunners 1-0 loss at [Newcastle United](/football/team?id=361) in September stand amid Arsenal's protests. Arteta successfully fought a Football Association charge following comments he made in the aftermath of Gordon's goal and the Gunners boss struck a more conciliatory tone after his side missed out on a chance to go top of the [Premier League](/football/league/_/name/ENG.1) as [Konstantinos Mavropanos](/soccer/player/_/id/242705/konstantinos-mavropanos) sealed West Ham's victory with a 55th-minute header. "I haven't seen it, [but] they're saying it's not conclusive," said Arteta. "It's a shame that with the technology that we have, that it's not that clear so that we can say whether it's out or in. It's done. It's gone. There's nothing we can do about it now. "If the technology we have at the moment is not good enough to give us that answer, what we have to do is without that win the game. With the number of situations we generated in the game, that should have been more than enough." Arsenal had 30 shots and ended with an Expected Goals figure of 2.68 after registering 77 touches in West Ham's box -- a record for a team failing to score in a Premier League game since Opta records began in 2008. "It is what it is," added Arteta. "We have to try to generate. If we don't score with 30 shots, then we have to do 50 or 60 to try to score. That's the only thing. I can't imagine a game where we have more touches in the box, more dominance and less situations for the opponent against a really good West Ham side. Today though, it wasn't enough to win the game." Meanwhile, West Ham boss David Moyes celebrated his first league win away at Arsenal, [Chelsea](/football/team?id=363), [Liverpool](/football/team?id=364) or [Manchester United](/football/team?id=360) in 73 attempts by hinting he could soon hold discussions over a new contract. Moyes, whose existing deal expires at the end of the season, said: "We are getting ready to talk. I don't think any of us are getting it done too quickly. I don't see any problems with that."

author: Natasha Kravchuk
title: Split Pea Soup Recipe (VIDEO)
text:
Split Pea Soup Recipe (VIDEO)
This homemade Split Pea Soup is the perfect cozy soup recipe as we roll into the winter months. This soup is a nutritious blend of split peas, savory ham, and sauteed vegetables creating the perfect comfort food to warm you from the inside out.
Split Pea Soup is our favorite way to use leftover
Baked Ham from the holidays, but it‚Äôs so customizable that you can even make it without a ham bone, adding diced ham or bacon. If you prefer to make it vegetarian, it will still taste amazing. Watch the video tutorial and see how easy it is.
This post may contain affiliate links. Read my
disclosure policy.
Be sure to try some of our other soup favorites like
Beef Stew or our Broccoli and Cheese Soup served right in an edible bread bowl. I love a hearty, nutritious, comforting bowl of soup on a cold Idaho winter day, and this Split Pea Soup checks all of the boxes. If you are a fan of hearty soups, this golden vegetable soup recipe is a must-try!
The Best Split Pea Soup Recipe
Growing up, my mom had the best Split Pea Soup recipe. She called it by its Ukrainian name, Horohoviy Soup. I remember back when I was working as a nurse, on a cold winter day, my husband called my mom for this recipe and became a culinary superhero. I was so surprised when I came home and he had a warm bowl of homemade Split Pea Soup waiting for me (Yep, I definitely married up). This isn‚Äôt just a bowl of soup‚Ä¶ It warms you up, does the body good, and takes me straight back to my childhood ‚Äì comfort in a bowl, my friends.
Split Pea Soup Video
Watch Natasha make Split Pea Soup. You will be surprised at how easy it is to make, the stove does most of the work. So grab your apron and let‚Äôs get cooking!
Here‚Äôs why you will love this recipe
- Easy ‚Äì this soup is so easy to make! Just chop, saut√©, simmer, and serve
- Rich and savory flavor ‚Äì between the yellow split peas, the ham, and the vegetables, oh, it‚Äôs so delicious
- Healthy comfort food ‚Äì it‚Äôs got the savory vegetables, the chicken stock, and the protein from the peas and ham ‚Äì a complete meal in one bowl
- Leftover friendly ‚Äì This soup can be made ahead and re-heats beautifully the next day. Dare I say, it tastes even better the next day
Ingredients
I love making this soup with yellow split peas. I prefer the flavor over green split peas and love the appealing golden color. A green-tinged soup is a hard sell for my kids so this is perfect!
- Olive Oil ‚Äì to saut√© the vegetables, you can also use butter
- Water and
Chicken Stock‚Äì create the base for this hearty soup
- Ham ‚Äì use diced ham or use your leftover Thanksgiving, Christmas, or Easter ham bone. After cooking, remove the ham hock. The tender meat will fall right off the bone, and you can add it right back into the soup.
- Split Peas ‚Äì I use dry,
golden split peas. They have a sweet flavor profile and are more visually appealing than green split peas (which is helpful especially when serving kids). No need to soak for hours (or even at all), the peas soften to create a creamy and satisfying texture. That said, you can use green split peas if that is what you have on hand.
- Vegetables ‚Äì potatoes, carrots, celery, yellow onion create the thick, flavorful base
- Flavor/Herbs ‚Äì garlic, bay leaves, fresh dill or parsley, thyme, salt, and pepper
Variations
- Ham Hock Bone ‚Äì if you enjoyed a
Roast Hamfor the holidays and have leftover ham bones, STOP! Don‚Äôt toss them- you can add the ham hock directly to your pot with the split peas. As it cooks, your soup will be infused with even more flavor and the meat left on the bone becomes so tender it falls right into the soup.
- Diced Ham‚Äì Saut√© two cups of diced ham in olive oil. Remove to saut√© the veggies and then add the ham right back into the pot when cooking the split peas.
- Pork Riblets ‚Äì You can cook pork riblets in the water with your split peas just like my mom does. Just be sure to skim off any impurities and avoid boiling vigorously. My mom also uses this for
Sorrel Soup.
- Bacon ‚Äì sautee bacon first then spoon it out and cook your veggies in the bacon fat. Use the browned crispy bacon as a topping for your soup.
- Bouillon Cubes ‚Äì Instead of chicken stock, use the chicken or vegetable bouillon equivalent by dissolving the
bouillon cubesor better than bouillonin water.
- Green Split Peas ‚Äì if this is your preference or if you aren‚Äôt able to find yellow split peas, the green ones will work in a pinch (but don‚Äôt tell my Mom ‚Äì k?)
What are split peas?
Split peas are dried green or
yellow peas that have, well, split. Peas have two halves inside of their outer shell that make up the round pea, and during the drying process, they separate. Split peas are the peeled halves and become very tender during the cooking process creating a smooth texture. They are low in fat and a good source of protein, fiber, and various vitamins and minerals which make them a great addition to soups and other recipes such as stews, salads, and curries.
Pro Tip:
I‚Äôve tested soaking the peas overnight in hopes of speeding up the cooking process but I didn‚Äôt notice any difference in timing. Just be sure to rinse and pick them over to remove any debris then drain your peas before adding them to the pot.
How to Make Split Pea Soup with Ham
- Saut√© ‚Äì Set a large soup pot or
5 1/2 quart Dutch ovenon the stovetop over medium-high heat and add olive oil. Add ham (or ham hock), and saut√© until golden brown. Remove the ham and set it to the side. Add olive oil and saut√© chopped onion and celery until softened (about 5 minutes).
- Combine‚Äì Add stock, water, and rinsed and drained peas. Add the ham back to the pot. Bring to a boil and skim off and discard any foam that rises to the top.
- Flavor and Simmer ‚Äì Add thyme and bay leaves and season with salt. Reduce heat to a simmer, partially cover, and simmer for 1 hour 30 minutes or until peas are almost dissolved. If using a ham hock, remove the bone from the soup, then shred the meat and return it to the pot.
- Simmer Additional Vegetables ‚Äì Add chopped carrots and potatoes and cook for another 20 minutes or until the veggies are fork-tender.
- Season and Serve ‚Äì Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove and discard the bay leaves and thyme stems. Press in the garlic, add dill or parsley and immediately turn off the heat. Serve topped with crispy bacon and more fresh herbs.
Pro Tip:
Add thyme sprigs to the pot whole ‚Äì no chopping needed. The leaves will fall off the stems, which are easy to remove later. Also, when the peas and ham come to a boil, the foam will rise to the top. Skim off and discard the foam for a cleaner-looking soup.
Optional Toppings for Split Pea Soup
Toppings really elevate a soup and there are so many ways to dress up a Split Pea Soup:
- Bacon Bits ‚Äì add a nice salty bite
Croutons‚Äì homemade is best, but you can also use storebought
- Fresh Herbs ‚Äì parsley, dill, or fresh thyme
- Ham ‚Äì diced cooked ham
- Cheese ‚Äì shredded parmesan
- Green Onion or Chives ‚Äì chop and sprinkle on top
- Pepper ‚Äì freshly cracked
How to Make Split Pea Soup in a Crockpot
Add all of your ingredients to your slow cooker, reducing the water by half since not as much water will evaporate as it cooks. Cook on low heat for 7 hours.
Common Questions
Split peas are nutritious ‚Äì a good source of protein, dietary fiber, and various vitamins and minerals. The combination of split peas and other vegetables in the soup makes this recipe a good source of protein, fiber, and essential nutrients.
You absolutely can. Gold split peas are just a personal preference for taste and appearance. You would use green split peas in the same way.
You can omit the ham or make it vegetarian. Use vegetable stock with the water to create the base for your broth.
If you find that your soup is too thick or if too much liquid evaporates, you can add more water or chicken broth to the soup to achieve your desired consistency.
Ham is naturally salty, so you can use less salt or low-sodium chicken stock to reduce your sodium intake if desired.
Keep in mind, that you don‚Äôt want to make the soup too thick since the soup will thicken up in the refrigerator. That said, using more split peas will give you a thicker consistency. You can also simmer uncovered for 20-30 extra minutes while cooking split peas to allow some of that extra liquid to evaporate.
What to Serve With Split Pea Soup
Split pea soup is a hearty and satisfying meal on its own, but its versatile ingredients also pair perfectly with:
- Bread ‚Äì
Crusty French Bread, soft Dinner Rolls, or fluffy Biscuitsare all great alongside or dipped right into your soup bowl
- Salad ‚Äì A light side salad such as a
Garden Salador a crisp Caesar Saladwould pair well with the richness of this soup. Roasted Vegetables‚Äì a great way to add more veggies to your diet
Make-Ahead
Split Pea Soup is one of those recipes that‚Äôs even better the next day after you have allowed the flavors to meld. Make sure to cool your soup to room temperature before storing it in the refrigerator or freezer. Tip: Pour your soup into shallow containers to allow it to cool faster.
- To Refrigerate: Store cooled soup in airtight containers for up to 4 days.
- Freezing: Use freezer-safe containers or heavy-duty Ziploc bags. Leave some space at the top of the container or bag to allow the soup to expand as it freezes. If using bags, lay the bag flat for easier storage and quick thawing.
- To Reheat: Thaw your soup in the refrigerator overnight. You can cook your thawed soup in the microwave or on the stovetop. If the soup has thickened, add water or broth to thin it out.
More Hearty Soup Recipes
If you love this Split Pea Soup recipe, then you won‚Äôt want to miss these hearty soup recipes:
Split Pea Soup Recipe
Ingredients
- 2 Tbsp
olive oil, divided
- 2 cups diced ham or ham hock, (10 oz)
- 1
medium onion, chopped
- 2 celery stalks, finely chopped
- 4 cups
chicken stock
- 8 cups water
- 1 1/2 cups
yellow dry split peas, rinsed and pickled over (11-12 oz)
- 2 sprigs of fresh thyme, or 1/4 tsp dried thyme leaves
- 2
bay leaves
- 5 medium Yukon or red potatoes, peeled and diced
- 2 medium carrots, peeled and sliced into half rings
- 1 1/2 tsp
fine sea salt, divided, added to taste
- 1/4 tsp
freshly ground black pepper
- 3 garlic cloves
- 2 Tbsp fresh dill or parsley, finely chopped
Instructions
- Set a large soup pot or
5 1/2 qt Dutch ovenover medium-high heat and add 1 Tbsp olive oil. Add ham (or ham hock, and sautee until golden brown). Remove ham to a separate plate.
- Add 1 Tbsp olive oil and saut√© onion and celery until softened, about 5 minutes. Add stock, water, and drained peas, and add ham back to the pot. Bring to a boil and skim off any foam that rises to the top.
- Add thyme and bay leaves and season with 1/2 tsp salt. Reduce heat to a simmer, partially cover and simmer for 1 hour 30 minutes or until peas are almost dissolved. If using a ham hock, remove bone from soup then shred the meat and put it back into the pot.
- Add carrots and potatoes and cook another 20 minutes or until veggies are fork-tender.
- Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove and discard the bay leaves and thyme stems.
- Press in the garlic, add dill or parsley, then immediately turn off the heat. Serve topped with crispy bacon and more fresh herbs.
Nutrition Per Serving

author: Mahnoor Jehangir
title: Moteurs Baudouin: Powering Data Centers with Sustainable and Customizable Solutions
text:
In an era where digital infrastructure is as critical as the very electricity that powers it, ensuring the uninterrupted operation of data centers has become paramount. Enter Moteurs Baudouin, the French engine powerhouse, with its groundbreaking approach to sustainable and customizable power solutions. On February 16, 2024, the company reaffirmed its commitment to innovation in the energy sector, offering a range of PowerKit Diesel and Gas engines designed to meet the exacting demands of data centers of all sizes.
Powering the Future of Data Centers
At the heart of Moteurs Baudouin‚Äôs offerings lie the PowerKit Diesel engines. With a power output spectrum ranging from 18 to 4,125kVA, these engines are not only versatile but also environmentally conscious. The ability to run on hydrotreated vegetable oils (HVO) marks a significant step towards reducing CO2 emissions by up to 90%. This advancement is not just about meeting today's standards but setting new benchmarks for sustainability in the power generation industry. Rigorously tested and compliant with Uptime Institute requirements, these engines promise reliability and efficiency, ensuring that data centers continue to operate smoothly, even in the face of unforeseen power disruptions.
A Leap Towards Eco-Friendly Solutions
Moteurs Baudouin doesn‚Äôt stop with diesel. The company has also pioneered the development of PowerKit Gas engines, which boast power outputs ranging from 63 to 1,750kVA. These engines are at the forefront of technology, being electronically controlled and CHP ready, which allows them to not only provide power but also support local production of electricity, heating, and cooling. Designed to operate in harsh and confined environments, these gas engines offer a resilient and uninterrupted power supply, underlining Moteurs Baudouin‚Äôs commitment to offering solutions that are as adaptable as they are sustainable.
Customized Solutions for Uninterrupted Operation
The versatility and efficiency of Moteurs Baudouin‚Äôs engines are matched by their customizability. Understanding that no two data centers are alike, the company offers tailor-made solutions to ensure that each facility receives an optimized power system that fits its specific needs. Whether it‚Äôs the compact but powerful 18kVA diesel engine or the robust 1,750kVA gas engine, Moteurs Baudouin ensures that data centers can rely on a continuous power supply. This commitment to uninterrupted operation is critical, especially during grid outages, ensuring that data centers remain operational, safeguarding the digital economy's backbone.
In the digital age, the importance of reliable and sustainable power solutions cannot be overstated. Moteurs Baudouin, with its innovative range of PowerKit Diesel and Gas engines, stands at the intersection of tradition and innovation. The company's dedication to environmental sustainability, coupled with its commitment to customizability and reliability, positions it as a leader in powering the data centers that are the heartbeat of our digital world. As we move forward, the role of companies like Moteurs Baudouin in ensuring the seamless operation of these critical infrastructures will only grow, making their contributions invaluable to the future of our interconnected society.
